issue.title: [CF 946] New Condition: Unit Class Specialization
issue.body:
Just a new condition that checks the spec of someone's class.


> Posted by CurseForge user Freeebo | Imported from CurseForge issue #946 | Raw

comments.body:
It's hard to do. Inspection can work on friendlies, but even inspection is limited by range and throttled by number of queries per min.

Aside from that, you can only make assumptions based on auras present/spells cast. To do something like this would require a lot of lists of a lot of spells and buffs for a lot of specs for a lot of classes.


> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras

Out of curiosity since this ticket is still up, is there something you need from me on my end to get this rolling? Or just keeping it open because it's a WIP that you'll get around to some day?


> Posted by CurseForge user Jalopyy

Yeah, just keeping it around because I might end up doing it eventually, but no plans right now.

Edited Aug 1, 2014

> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras

Quick question about this condition.

Obviously to build it from scratch would require a long list of aura/casts behind the scenes. But what about other addons which fetch the spec of the person in question, could TMW have a way to check through that addon the spec for a condition?

Example, GladiusEx (and all Gladius addons) retrieve the spec of the player on the enemy team via...well, however they do it. Would it be hard for TMW to check the arena frame/through the addon to have a condition that works only on arena1-5 specializations to activate?


> Posted by CurseForge user Jalopyy

Specs of enemies in arenas are pretty easy to get. No guessing needed - its available thru the blizz API. Same with battlegrounds, too, actually.


> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras

Do you think for the meantime it'd be possible to push an update where this condition, then, working only for arena1-5 and whatever in battlegrounds? Most of what I originally wanted from this condition was tailored for arena uses.


> Posted by CurseForge user Jalopyy

Ok. Its now in both branches.


> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras
